intro: Hedyotis macraei, commonly known as the mountain mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Hedyotis macraei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
